## Dataset Overview {#dataset-overview}

This portfolio explores the Palmer Penguins dataset to understand how penguin species differ in morphology and habitat. The goal is to practice data visualization, summary statistics, and exploratory data analysis using R and Quarto.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Descriptive Statistics {#descriptive-statistics}

### Summary Statistics of Key Measurements

``` r
summary(penguins[, c("bill_length_mm", "bill_depth_mm", "flipper_length_mm", "body_mass_g")])
```

Figure 1: Summary statistics of bill length, bill depth, flipper length, and body mass

### Count by Species and Sex

``` r
penguins |> 
  filter(!is.na(sex)) |> 
  count(species, sex) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = sex, values_from = n, values_fill = 0)
```

Figure 5: Penguin count by species and sex


### Mean Measurements by Species

``` r
penguins |> 
  filter(!is.na(bill_length_mm), !is.na(bill_depth_mm)) |>
  group_by(species) |>
  summarise(
    mean_bill_length = mean(bill_length_mm),
    mean_bill_depth = mean(bill_depth_mm),
    mean_flipper_length = mean(flipper_length_mm),
    mean_body_mass = mean(body_mass_g)
  )
```

Figure 8: Mean morphological measurements by species

------------------------------------------------------------------------

``` r
penguins |>
```

### Mode Measurements by Sex

``` r
get_mode <- function(x) {
  ux <- na.omit(unique(x))
  ux[which.max(tabulate(match(x, ux)))]
}

penguins |> 
  filter(!is.na(bill_length_mm), !is.na(bill_depth_mm), !is.na(sex)) |>
  group_by(sex) |>
  summarise(
    mode_bill_length = get_mode(bill_length_mm),
    mode_bill_depth = get_mode(bill_depth_mm),
    mode_flipper_length = get_mode(flipper_length_mm),
    mode_body_mass = get_mode(body_mass_g)
  )
```

Figure 12: Mode morphological measurements by sex

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Visualization {#visualization}

### Bill Length vs Bill Depth by Species

``` r
penguins |> 
  filter(!is.na(bill_length_mm), !is.na(bill_depth_mm)) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(
    title = "Bill Length vs Bill Depth by Species",
    x = "Bill Length (mm)",
    y = "Bill Depth (mm)",
    color = "Species"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

Figure 14: A scatterplot of bill length and depth colored by species

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Flipper Length vs Body Mass by Species

``` r
penguins |> 
  filter(!is.na(flipper_length_mm), !is.na(body_mass_g)) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = flipper_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(
    title = "Flipper Length vs Body Mass by Species",
    x = "Flipper Length (mm)",
    y = "Body Mass (g)",
    color = "Species"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

Figure 15: A scatterplot of flipper length and body mass colored by species

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Body Mass Distribution by Species

``` r
penguins |> 
  filter(!is.na(body_mass_g)) |>
  ggplot(aes(x = species, y = body_mass_g)) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(fill = species)) +
  labs(
    title = "Body Mass Distribution by Species",
    x = "Species",
    y = "Body Mass (g)"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

Figure 16: A boxplot of body mass by species

------------------------------------------------------------------------

### Species Distribution by Island

``` r
penguins |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = island, fill = species)) +
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  labs(
    title = "Species Distribution by Island",
    x = "Island",
    y = "Count",
    fill = "Species"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

Figure 17: A barplot showing species distribution by island
